{{This date in recent years}}
{{Day}}

==Events==
*[[202 BC]] &ndash; coronation ceremony of Liu Bang as [[Emperor Gaozu of Han]] takes place, initiating four centuries of the [[Han Dynasty]]'s rule over China.
* [[628]] &ndash; [[Khosrau II]] is executed by [[Mihr Hormozd]] under the orders of [[Kavadh II]].
* [[870]] &ndash; The [[Fourth Council of Constantinople (Roman Catholic)|Fourth Council of Constantinople]] closes.
*[[1246]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Jaén (1245–46)|Siege of Jaén]] ends in the context of the [[Spanish Reconquista]] resulting in the Castilian takeover of the city from the Taifa of Jaen.
*[[1525]] &ndash; The [[Aztec]] king [[Cuauhtémoc]] is executed by [[Hernán Cortés]]'s forces.
*[[1638]] &ndash; The Scottish [[National Covenant]] is signed in [[Edinburgh]].
*[[1700]] &ndash; Today is followed by [[March 1]] in Sweden, thus creating the [[Swedish calendar]].
*[[1710]] &ndash; In the [[Battle of Helsingborg (1710)|Battle of Helsingborg]], 14,000 Danish invaders under [[Jørgen Rantzau]] are decisively defeated by an equally sized Swedish force under [[Magnus Stenbock]]. This is the last time Swedish and Danish troops meet on Swedish soil.
*[[1784]] &ndash; [[John Wesley]] charters the [[Methodism|Methodist Church]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; ''[[Cry of Asencio]]'', beginning of the Uruguayan War of Independence
*[[1827]] &ndash; The [[Baltimore & Ohio Railroad]] is incorporated, becoming the first [[railroad]] in America offering commercial transportation of both people and freight.
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Robert Nelson (insurrectionist)|Robert Nelson]], leader of the [[Patriotes]], proclaims the independence of [[Lower Canada]] (today [[Quebec]])
*[[1844]] &ndash; A gun on {{USS|Princeton|1843|6}} explodes while the boat is on a [[Potomac River]] cruise, killing eight people, including two [[United States Cabinet]] members.
*[[1849]] &ndash; Regular [[steamboat]] service from the west to the east coast of the United States begins with the arrival of the {{SS|California|1848|6}} in [[San Francisco Bay]], 4 months 22 days after leaving [[New York Harbor]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; Seventy years of [[Holy See-United States relations]] are ended by a [[United States Congress|Congressional]] ban on federal funding of [[diplomacy|diplomatic]] [[Diplomatic rank#Multilateral diplomacy|envoys]] to the Vatican and are not restored until [[January 10]], [[1984]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; The [[Bulgarian Exarchate]] is established by decree of [[Sultan Abd-ul-Aziz of the Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; One of the longest cases ever heard in an English court ends when the defendant is convicted of [[perjury]] for [[Tichborne case|attempting to assume the identity]] of the heir to the [[Tichborne baronets|Tichborne baronetcy]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; The first [[vaudeville]] theater opens in [[Boston]]
*[[1885]] &ndash; The [[American Telephone and Telegraph Company]] is incorporated in [[New York State]] as the subsidiary of American Bell Telephone. (American Bell would later merge with its subsidiary.)
*[[1893]] &ndash; The {{USS|Indiana|BB-1|6}}, the lead ship of [[Indiana-class battleship|her class]] and the first [[battleship]] in the [[United States Navy]] comparable to foreign battleships of the time, is launched.
*[[1897]] &ndash; [[Ranavalona III of Madagascar|Queen Ranavalona III]], the last monarch of [[Madagascar]], is deposed by a French military force.
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[Second Boer War]]: The 118-day "[[Siege of Ladysmith]]" is lifted.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Autonomous Republic of Northern Epirus]] is proclaimed in [[Gjirokastër]], by the Greeks living in southern [[Albania]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The United Kingdom ends its [[protectorate]] over [[Egypt]] through a [[Unilateral Declaration of Egyptian Independence|Unilateral Declaration of Independence]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; The [[1925 Charlevoix–Kamouraska earthquake|Charlevoix-Kamouraska earthquake]] strikes northeastern North America.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[C.V. Raman]] discovers the [[Raman effect]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; ''[[Gleichschaltung]]'': The [[Reichstag Fire Decree]] is passed in Germany a day after the [[Reichstag fire]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[DuPont]] scientist [[Wallace Carothers]] invents [[nylon]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The erroneous word "[[dord]]" is discovered in the ''[[Webster's Dictionary|Webster's New International Dictionary, Second Edition]]'', prompting an investigation.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Basketball]] is [[Broadcasting of sports events|televised]] for the first time ([[Fordham Rams|Fordham University]] vs. the [[Pittsburgh Panthers men's basketball|University of Pittsburgh]] in [[Madison Square Garden]]).
*[[1942]] &ndash; The heavy cruiser {{USS|Houston|CA-30|6}} is sunk in the [[Battle of Sunda Strait]] with 693 crew members killed, along with {{HMAS|Perth|D29|6}} which lost 375 men.
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[228 Incident]]: In [[Taiwan]], civil disorder is put down with the loss of an estimated 30,000 civilians.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[James D. Watson]] and [[Francis Crick]] announce to friends that they have determined the chemical structure of [[DNA]]; the formal announcement takes place on [[April 25]] following publication in April's ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'' (pub. [[April 2]]).
*[[1954]] &ndash; The first [[color television]] sets using the [[NTSC]] standard are offered for sale to the general public.
*[[1958]] &ndash; A school bus in [[Floyd County, Kentucky]] hits a wrecker truck and plunges down an embankment into the rain-swollen [[Levisa Fork River]]. The driver and 26 children die in what remains [[Prestonsburg, Kentucky bus disaster|one of the worst school bus accidents]] in U.S. history.
*[[1959]] &ndash; ''[[Discoverer 1]]'', an American [[spy satellite]] that is the first object intended to achieve a [[polar orbit]], is launched. It failed to achieve orbit.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Sino-American relations]]: The United States and People's Republic of China sign the [[Shanghai Communiqué]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; In London an underground train [[Moorgate tube crash|fails to stop]] at Moorgate terminus station and crashes into the end of the tunnel, killing 43 people.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Andalusia]] approves its [[Autonomous communities of Spain|statute of autonomy]] through a [[referendum]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] carries out a [[1985 Newry mortar attack|mortar attack]] on the [[Royal Ulster Constabulary]] police station at [[Newry]], killing nine officers in the highest loss of life for the RUC on a single day.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Olof Palme]], prime minister of Sweden, is [[Assassination of Olof Palme|assassinated]] in Stockholm.
*[[1991]] &ndash; The first [[Gulf War]] ends.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms]] agents [[Waco siege|raid]] the [[Branch Davidian]] church in [[Waco, Texas]] with a warrant to arrest the group's leader [[David Koresh]]. Four BATF agents and five Davidians die in the initial raid, starting a 51-day standoff.
*[[1995]] &ndash; Former Australian Liberal party leader [[John Hewson]] resigns from the Australian parliament almost two years after losing the [[Australian federal election, 1993]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; An [[1997 Ardabil earthquake|earthquake]] in northern [[Iran]] is responsible for about 3,000 deaths.
*  1997   &ndash; The [[North Hollywood shootout]] takes place, resulting in the injury of 19 people and the deaths of both perpetrators.
*  1997   &ndash; [[GRB 970228]], a highly luminous flash of [[gamma ray]]s, strikes the Earth for 80 seconds, providing early evidence that [[gamma-ray burst]]s occur well beyond the [[Milky Way]].
*  1997   &ndash; [[1997 military memorandum (Turkey)|Military Coup]] in [[Turkey]]
*[[1998]] &ndash; First flight of RQ-4 [[Global Hawk]], the first [[unmanned aerial vehicle]] certified to file its own flight plans and fly regularly in U.S. civilian airspace.
*  1998   &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: [[Serbia and Montenegro|Serbian]] police begin the offensive against the [[Kosovo Liberation Army]] in [[Kosovo]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[2001 Nisqually earthquake|Nisqually Earthquake]] measuring 6.8 on the [[Richter Scale]] hits the Nisqually Valley and the [[Seattle]], [[Tacoma, Washington|Tacoma]], and [[Olympia, Washington|Olympia]] area of the U.S. state of [[Washington (state)|Washington]].
*  2001   &ndash; Six passengers and four railway staff are killed and a further 82 people suffer serious injuries in the [[Selby rail crash]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; During the [[2002 Gujarat riots|religious violence in Gujarat]], the 97 people killed in the [[Naroda Patiya massacre]] and 69 in [[Gulbarg Society massacre]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; Over one million [[Taiwan]]ese participating in the [[228 Hand-in-Hand Rally]] form a {{convert|500|km|mi|adj=on}} long human chain to commemorate the [[228 Incident]] in [[1947]]
*[[2005]] &ndash; A [[2005 Al Hillah bombing|suicide bombing]] at a police recruiting centre in [[Al Hillah]], [[Iraq]] kills 127.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Pope Benedict XVI]] [[Resignation of Pope Benedict XVI|resigns]] as the pope of the [[Catholic Church]] becoming the first pope to do so since 1415.
